attributes.action: have Clause 76 of the Counter Terrorism Act 2008 amended so that people do not have to prove their innocence and review all other legislation that contradict the principle of innocent until proven guilty.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Clause 76, paragraph (2) of the Counter Terrorism Act 2008 states that a person accused under that section has to prove that they are innocent.  This goes against the principles of natural justice that define the freedom and the culture of the UK.  There is no reason that, in a modern democratic state, we need to set aside our principles to fight any crimes.

Our rights exist to protect us from tyranny and, whilst any particular Government may not abuse their powers, rescinding those right opens the way for a future Government to do that.
